kenjar_campus.source_note: Information for Kenjar Campus (primarily Shree Devi Institute of Technology - SDIT). The provided dataset states its own hostel data (e.g., in entries 'gen_Hos_Rul_2', 'gen_Hos_Boy_12') consists of 'placeholders' and 'approximations' that must be verified. The following combines dataset information with details from a web search.

rules.detail: General rules are in place regarding noise levels, common area usage, and guest policies.
Hostel policies include a lights-out time and a visitor policy.
First-year students who are not from Karnataka are required to stay in the hostel.
If boys opt for the hostel, they are required to stay for 2 years compulsorily.
The hostel has a mess menu rotation system.
An emergency contact procedure is in place.

facilities_and_amenities.detail: Separate hostels are available for boys and girls.
Options for single, double, and triple occupancy rooms are available. Some reviews mention 3 members per room.
Rooms are well-furnished with essential amenities like beds, study tables, chairs, and wardrobes.
Rooms have attached bathrooms, regular cleaning services, and round-the-clock hot water.
A hygienic mess provides nutritious meals. Food quality is described as 'not absolutely good' by one review.
There are conflicting reports on Wi-Fi. Some sources state high-speed internet is provided, while a student review claims it is lacking.
Common areas include TV rooms, lounges, and spaces for indoor games and fitness equipment. An information center with access to TV and newspapers is also mentioned.
Convenient laundry facilities are available. Shuttle services (college buses) are provided for transport, potentially at an extra charge.

administration_and_security.detail: The hostel provides 24/7 security, including CCTV surveillance and security personnel.
A hostel warden is present to manage day-to-day operations, assist students, and maintain discipline.
Medical assistance and emergency services are readily available.

mg_road_campus.source_note: Information for M.G. Road Campus (also referred to as Ballalbagh). This campus hosts multiple colleges (Physiotherapy, Hotel Management, Nursing, etc.). Details are synthesized from the dataset and web search results.

rules.detail: All hostelers are compulsorily required to be inside the hostel by 6:30 PM sharp.
Students are required to take permission from their respective class coordinator and the principal if they need to go home.
According to one review, boys are to stay in the hostel for 2 years compulsorily, and girls are required to stay for the whole tenure of the course.

facilities_and_amenities.detail: Separate hostel facilities are provided for boys and girls. Hostels are described as spacious and are located on campus or within accessible distance.
Rooms accommodate 3 or 4 students per room.
Rooms are described as comfortable, with attached bathrooms/washrooms, and adequate furniture.
Facilities include round-the-clock hot water, hot and cold water filters, and regular cleaning services.
A hygienic mess hall provides nutritious food. Food quality is rated as 'average' to 'good and hygienic'.
One listing mentions free Wi-Fi access in all rooms and common areas.
An information center with access to TV and newspapers is available. Common spaces for socializing and relaxation are also mentioned.
A fully equipped kitchen is mentioned in one source.

administration_and_security.detail: The hostel provides 24/7 security with CCTV surveillance.
A hostel Warden is responsible for discipline, maintenance of the buildings, and allotment of rooms.
